Posts.Content: Jun 26, 2008 05:36PM kisersassy wrote: Oh Diane sounds like maybe the fill in Doc is the right medicine.  I read that you are learning what foods to eat and when.  My grandma is going to be Starting Xeloda next week when it arrives in the mail. It would be great to give her some advice on it.  I already warned her about the Utter Smooth cream and the Immodium AD she had my grandpa go get it for her to be prepared. I dont know yet, but I am under the assumption that they are putting her on just one pill a day and one pill of Tykerb a day because of all her other health problems. They also gave her oxicodone for the pain and silly her said she was only going to take them in dire straights so that she doesnt run out.  I told her to take them whenever she wanted for pain no need to suffer because when they run out the Dr will give her more and more.  But she will be 76 years old on the 8th and she hates meds, but again she doesnt need to suffer with pain in this day and age. Rhonda

Posts.Title: Update kisersassy VickiG

Posts.Content: kisersassy wrote: Hello everyone, I have been reading alot of your posts and really have been going through some personal stresses not related to grandma so havent really felt like talking to much.  Grandma seems to look a lot better.  She started at home physical therapy so that she can strengthen her legs to be able to walk.  When I went down to see her today, she was cooking (thank goodness i arrived when i did as it was burning on the stove, poor thing) but, she was trying and that is what counts.  There is a different look to her though today.  Her skin color is kind of weird looking.  Not yellow, but kind of like a ashy grey looking, but not pale.  Her stomach still looks really swollen but her legs didnt look swollen like they usually are.  I am scared to let my guard down as I know how she goes down hill so fast when we think she is sooo much better.  I know because of her other health problems she cannot be on aggressive treatments.  she is still only on 3 pills of tykerb a day and only 1-500 mg of xeloda at night.  No one has mentioned, not even her Dr. about the lymph nodes that were discovered while she was in the hospital a couple weeks ago.  I know they said she couldnt not go through biopsy's.  So, I am wondering how often do they do CT-PET scans, MRI's, and bone scans to see if the meds are working or not?  Also, because she chose not to do radiation will that effect her prognosis? Hugs to all Rhonda Rhonda Dx 9/2007, IDC, <1cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 0/7 nodes, ER-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Update kisersassy VickiG

Posts.Content: kisersassy wrote: Hello Ladies, I havent posted in awhile, but my grandma had a PET scan last month and we finally today got the results.  Not from her Dr but we requested the report from the hospital. It shows that compared to her last PET, she has increased findings in her humerous heads, sternum, and spine.  A bone scan was done today and we will find out the results on the 19th to see if it is just arthritis.  But can you get arthritis in the sternum? It shows moderate right plueral effusion and pericardial effusion moderate. Calcification and enlargement of the spleen. Plus harding of her carotid arteries.  She has had this but it is worst. I will keep you updated when we go to the Dr on the 19th. Rhonda Dx 9/2007, IDC, <1cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 0/7 nodes, ER-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply

One it is worst.  Now for about a month she has a chronic cough.  She does have COPD but I think its mets as well. Thanks Rhonda
Posts.Title: Update kisersassy kisersassy

Posts.Content: Feb 19, 2009 03:39PM kisersassy wrote: Thank you all for your support.  I have mixed messages from her Onc today.  The PET scan showed increased activity since her last scan in her ribs, sternum, and spine.  My grandma is in so much pain at night from her back.  The Bone Scan that was ordered didnt mention anything about her sternum or her spine, but did her ribs.  The Dr is not ruling out mets to the spine or sternum but in my grandmas state no biopsy can be done.  We go next week to discuss radiation therapy for her ribs, and possible on her spine in the future.  My question is "Is it possible that the spine and sternum are mets since there is an increase since last scans done in May?"  We went over so much I cant remember everything.  I do know she will be staying on the Xeloda as her tumor markers went from 43. something to 36. something.  Her liver levels are elelvated but Onc said it has always been up some, so not to worry about that as the scans did not show anything on her liver.
Posts.Title: Update kisersassy kisersassy

Posts.Content: kisersassy wrote: Hello Ladies, I am sorry if this gets too long and if I rant some.  I am so frustrated I just dont know what to do.. In updates I told you about grandmas increased activity in her spine, sternum, knees, humurous heads, and a new spot along with the other spots on her ribs from the PET scan she had done in May of 08 to the one she had in January of 09.  Also a new spot on a new rib showed up on her bone scan from the previous bone scan.  Welllllll, my grandma was in so much pain we took her to the hospital yesterday and they gave her 3 doses of morphine and then told her to go home and take Oxicodone that her Onc (which is a Nurse Practitioner) prescribed her.  These were prescribed months ago and my grandpa refused to let her take them because he did not want her to get addicted to them.  So finally with the updates on the scans and from yesterday he finally agreed to let her take them.  Well, My aunt in the mean time had called her Onc and the Onc finally got back to her today.  What I am frustrated with totally is that the Onc told my Aunt 100% different story than what she told me.  She told my Aunt that she does not have mets to any organ, any bone, nor her brain, nor her lungs.  THIS IS GREAT NEWS SO DONT GET ME WRONG.  Ok so if that is the case she would be considered a Stage 1?  If so why did she tell me 3 months or so ago my grandma was a Late Stage III definatley and probably a Stage IV?  She told my Aunt that grandma just has Arthritis and Osteoporosis.  She also said that her breast are clear with no signs of cancer.  Well, her Mammo report showed a spot but they said it is probably benign (I read this report personally along with her PET reports) The Onc had set her up to seek Radiation Treatments especially on the Rib that showed up and possible later the spine.  They also tried Zometa about 7 months ago which she could only do a half dose as it messed with her kidneys so no more Zometa was given.  Why then are they treating her for BC if she doesnt have it?  Why give a 76 year old who has severe CHF Chemo tx etc... for something she doesnt have?  Why is the Onc telling me personally one thing in front of my face, but when other family members call tell them on the phone something completely different?  Now again my grandpa thinks I was overexagerating her condition and is spreading it to the other members of the family.  Mind you II am the one taking her to all her appointments which is about 3 appointments a week.  If she is NED why are we going to the Onc 2 times a week?  I just dont understand any of this.  All I want is my grandma to have the correct care, the correct diagnosis. Please someone explain to me whats going on????? why is the definitions of Stage I to Stage IV different in my grandmas case?  Why are they treating her for something they are telling my aunt she doesnt have? Thank You Rhonda Rhonda Dx 9/2007, IDC, <1cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 0/7 nodes, ER-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Jun 26, 2008 05:47PM kisersassy wrote: Diane I went and searched and found this It is possible to have false results on a PET scan. Blood sugar or insulin levels may affect the test results in people with diabetes. I read that on http://www.stlukes-stl.com/health_content/health_ency/1/003827.htm They say usually a PET/CT scan is done instead, I am not sure if a CT was done or not.  I know she goes on her birthday on the 8th and they are doing 3 different MRI's.  And on the 7th a Mammogram. So I do know without treatment it can happen, and what I have read even with treatments it can spread fast.  However, reading others on this site, I have read miracles and so much hope from everyone and just reading here I feel so calm and overwhelmed that I am afraid I will say the wrong thing or offend someone because I cant get my words to relay how I am feeling. Posts.Content: Mar 23, 2009 11:43AM kisersassy wrote: Thank you for your kind thoughts and all of your prayers.  Grandma went through her 2nd dialysis treatment today.  They may let her come home on Wednesday, not sure yet on the care plan.  I cant say how she is doing as sometimes she seems as good as expected, but then she throws these delusional things in that dont make sense (she is only taking loretab and that only once a day) she was taking this at home and no episodes of this behavior.  She is eating some which is good, they were able to get 4 lbs of the 40 lbs of fluid off of her today.  However well she may look, the numbers of the labs etc.. say otherwise.  With dialysis her creatinine and bun should be going down, instead they are rising is what a Dialysis nurse told me.  She sometimes has normal blood pressure then at times it bottoms to like 85/36.  Any type of exsurtion her oxygen level drops in the low 80's especially if she turns on her side.  She is in constant pain when she breaths, and her back is hurting, but she is refusing and holding off pain meds as long in the day as possible because she wants to be alert.  I am still trying to figure out why they moved her from ICU to a regular room being she is not stable for more than a few hours or so.  I dont want to offend anyone but is it normal for her to say she sees shadowy things and they are pushing on her arm as if to wake her up?  the other day i was sitting with her all night, she grabs my hands then looks accross the room and tells someone who is not there  and says "Have a seat Clayton"  Well this was her son and he passed away 4 years ago.  Maybe this isnt the best forum to talk about this on, but you all in this forum has been here with me since I first joined last year. Hugs Rhonda

Posts.Content: kisersassy wrote: Hello all.  Grandma is still in the hospital.  The kidney Dr is going to try dialysis even after 4 other Dr's and the Nurse confirm she has 0% chance of improving.  They are advising for her to be released into hospice care at home so she can be with her family, saying her kidneys and the cancer being the reason for this down turn.  What upsets me is the fight I have been having all along that it is cancer and it has spread and the Nurse Practioner Onc saying its only arthritis.  Well, that Nurse confirmed today that she probably has till the end of the week. So we all have been coming to terms with this until this kidney Dr out of know where says lets prolong her suffering and try dialysis which is a 50-50 chance he said.  But, me not having any say so on her care has to sit by and watch her suffer in this pain even longer. But, I want to thank you all for all of your prayers and your advice and your shoulders that you have let me lean on. Posts.Content: Sep 9, 2008 05:38PM kisersassy wrote: My grandma is on Xeloda, and the only thing the Dr says about others touching the meds, is that if your breast feeding, or if you plan to become pregnant not to touch the meds. That is because they have not done  studies to prove if it effects pregnancies or breast milk in mothers that handle the medicine for others. I know if you were taking it yourself and were breastfeeding it would go to the baby ditto for pregnancy. other then that it is quite safe to be around and handle. Rhonda

Posts.Content: kisersassy wrote: Hi everyone, its been a little bit since I have posted, been so busy moving from my moms house to our new house. I am now living right behind maybe 100 ft from my grandparents.  had some bad news yesterday that my Aunts husband's mother passed away from her cancer 2 days ago. My mom was going to come in to visit me today, but my step-father (who has cancer) has taken a major change for the worst so they are rushing there. now, about my Grandma, I went over today, I am guilty because of moving I havent walked over there in a few days, and she looks awful.  Her face is swollen again, her eyes are so puffy.  She is very weak and tired.  She says she doesnt even have interest in watching her soaps anymore.  And, today she said she thinks her son (My Uncle who passed away 4 years ago) is coming to get her to be with him.  She did seem a little depressed, but I really think that hearing the bad news about my Aunts MIL, and my step-dads father both having cancer, is making her look at her cancer.  Then, my grandpa who is 82 is having major prostate problems and is in so much pain etc... he is finally going to the Dr next week. (He is very stubborn and thinks he is immortal God love him), so I am thinking this is all weighing heavy on her mind. She goes back to the Dr on Tuesday and Im going to go with her as I havent got to on the last few appointments.  I am thinking they need to update her scans.  Do they do them every 3 months or so?  She hasnt had any since she was diagnosed with the mets about 5 months ago I am thinking.  they still have her on 1500 mgs of Tykerb and 2 doses of Xeloda (1000 Mgs) one week on and one week off. Thank you all for letting me rant and ask questions. Prayers to all Rhonda Rhonda Dx 9/2007, IDC, <1cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 0/7 nodes, ER-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Mar 2, 2009 07:57PM kisersassy wrote: I just had a root canal done. luckily I did have dental insurance through my husbands work.. what I am doing though which the root canal was around 800 bucks, i scheduled the crown part for later.  that way it is breaking up the cost.  they put a temp filling in it until a permanent crown can be placed.  I still havent had the crown on and so far no probs at all from the temp filling.

Posts.Content: Nov 6, 2008 08:29PM kisersassy wrote: From what I have researched and from my grandma's experience on Xeloda she did not lose her hair.  You do have to watch out for the hand foot syndrome and since you are starting on a high dose diarhea may occur but dont get discouraged as they can lower it to ease the side effects. Would be wise to get a bottle of immodium AD just in case. Rhonda
